On one website: it says:

 Bad upbringing at home can make people insensitive to other people's feelings and emotions. They are happy to see their classmate depressed, sad and hurt. 

I fail to see how that makes people insensitive and feel this explanation needs more elaboration. It's amazing how it happens anyway, since causing pain to someone who has done nothing to you over the most meaningless, trivial reasons or over differences that don't even pose a fatal threat to others. Nidoto Mezamenu Komoriuta is one example of how horrifying it is, even thought it's just animation. There are always ways to deal with bullying and make it stop and lead a happy life, it just takes the right amount of perseverance and determination.

hey people out there, my friend who I've known for a long time has gotten bullied. People told him that the world would be better without him. He cried and went to he nurses office and I had no idea what to do. So I went up the the front of the classroom and asked the teacher if I could speak on his behalf. I told everyone to be put themselves in his shoes. By the sympathy of him and the nervousness of seeing all of the people I started crying in front of the class. I got to see him in the nurses office and right now (2 days later) he hasn't come to school and I am the only person he will talk to. But I have made progress and stopped the gossip and people talking rudely about him. I think I will show them this video so that they know exactly what its like. The past 3 days have been an emotional roller-coaster, but by doing the one small act of sticking up for a friend, I saved him from not feeling alone and a depression. That is my story and I hope that all off you can stick up for someone bullied someday. I hope you believe this because is 100% true., otherwise I would not comment something this long.
